p:
The next steps of this work could include, for instance, the calculation of the cooperativity factor
σ
[ 45] in order to place the modelled azobenzene star on the cooperativity scale for BTA-cored derivatives. Another interesting topic is related to the recently published paper by Bochicchio et al. [ 68] on the light-induced evolution of an azobenzene-containing supramolecular tubule in view of our data showed in Figure 6, where the defects are characterized quantitatively for the azo–BTA column. Finally, here we considered the stacks of azobenzenes in the dark, i.e., the stars in all-trans state. It would be interesting to elucidate the behavior of all-cis azo–BTA stars and the energetics of their self-assembly, since, as we showed recently, the stacks made by all-cis azobenzene stars maintain their clusters upon light stimulus, even though their shape is more disordered, as compared to the stacks in the dark.
